title.$t: Family, Part 3 - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Family, Part 3 - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: Let's learn MORE about family! This is the third of a series in the ASL Snippets collection that will cover all of the family relationships. Because there are a lot of signs relating to family. I'm breaking it up into sections. So, have fun watching and learning! In this video we have a husband and wife and their kids. Now the kids grow up and find a husband and wife of their own! Pay special attention to how I use the space around my body to set up where each family member is. As we add more and more family members, being able to place and identify each one clearly is very important.

content.$t: Let's learn MORE about family! This is the third of a series in the ASL Snippets collection that will cover all of the family relationships. Because there are a lot of signs relating to family. I'm breaking it up into sections. So, have fun watching and learning! In this video we have a husband and wife and their kids. Now the kids grow up and find a husband and wife of their own! Pay special attention to how I use the space around my body to set up where each family member is. As we add more and more family members, being able to place and identify each one clearly is very important.

title.$t: Family, Part 2 - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Family, Part 2 - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: Let's learn MORE about family! This is the second of a series in the ASL Snippets collection that will cover all of the family relationships. Because there are a lot of signs relating to family. I'm breaking it up into sections. So, have fun watching and learning! In this video boy and girl are now married, along come the kids! Pay special attention to how I use the space around my body to set up where each family member is. This is an important part of ASL - using spatial relationships.

content.$t: Let's learn MORE about family! This is the second of a series in the ASL Snippets collection that will cover all of the family relationships. Pay special attention to how I use the space around my body to set up where each family member is. This is an important part of ASL - using spatial relationships.

title.$t: Family, Part 1 - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Family, Part 1 - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: Let's learn about family! This is the first of a series in the ASL Snippets collection that will cover all of the family relationships. Because there are a lot of signs relating to family. I'm breaking it up into sections. So, have fun watching and learning! In this video we'll cover the story of boy meets girl, boy courts girl, boy marries girl.

content.$t: Let's learn about family! This is the first of a series in the ASL Snippets collection that will cover all of the family relationships. Because there are a lot of signs relating to family. I'm breaking it up into sections. So, have fun watching and learning! In this video we'll cover the story of boy meets girl, boy courts girl, boy marries girl.

title.$t: Timber! - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Timber! - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: This is my variation of a very popular old Deaf joke. I use several classifiers (descriptive handshapes) and NMS (non-manual signals - or mouth movements). I also demonstrate "role-shifting." This is where I shift my shoulders / upper body back and forth to represent more than one person.

content.$t: This is my variation of a very popular old Deaf joke. I use several classifiers (descriptive handshapes) and NMS (non-manual signals - or mouth movements). I also demonstrate "role-shifting." This is where I shift my shoulders / upper body back and forth to represent more than one person.

title.$t: First Easter (and now) - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: First Easter (and now) - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t:
This video introduces a very short and condensed version of the First Easter. Afterwards, I demonstrate some Easter-related signs.

P.S. One thing I'm really bummed about is that after recording my students making some videos, I forgot to change my camera back to the High Definition settings, so the video was recorded at a much lower quality (and not in wide screen either). Sorry about that!

content.$t:
This video introduces a very short and condensed version of the First Easter. Afterwards, I demonstrate some Easter-related signs.

P.S. One thing I'm really bummed about is that after recording my students making some videos, I forgot to change my camera back to the High Definition settings, so the video was recorded at a much lower quality (and not in wide screen either). Sorry about that!

title.$t: Saint Patrick's Day - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Saint Patrick's Day - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: This ASL Snippet focuses on a few Saint Patrick's Day concepts. In addition to doing signs, I'm also demonstrating what is called "classifiers." Classifiers are descriptive handshapes.We'll continue to go more in-depth on classifiers.

content.$t: This ASL Snippet focuses on a few Saint Patrick's Day concepts. In addition to doing signs, I'm also demonstrating what is called "classifiers." Classifiers are descriptive handshapes.We'll continue to go more in-depth on classifiers.

title.$t: A funny joke - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: A funny joke - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: This ASL Snippet is a very simple joke. The punchline (the funny part at the end) is especially funny because it uses a very particular sign. If you don't know the sign, go back and watch the ASL Snippets video playlist to learn signs you that you don't understand. Hope you enjoy the joke!

title.$t: Valentines Day - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Valentines Day - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: February 14 is Valentine's Day! Let's celebrate with a video especially made for the occasion. Let's learn some common signs that relate to the theme of Valentine's Day and "love." Hope you enjoy this ASL Snippets video. Be sure to click thumbs up, leave a comment, and share with others!

Hope you enjoy this ASL Snippets video. Be sure to click thumbs up, leave a comment, and share with others!

title.$t: Gender, height, width - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Gender, height, width - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t:
In this ASL Snippet we will cover gender (both for older and younger) as well as the signs for body height and width. Pay special attention to my mouth expressions (known as "mouth morphemes"). These mouth morphemes are an important part of 
American Sign Language. So make sure you not only practice the signs, but also practice the mouth morphemes as you continue to learn ASL.

content.$t:
In this ASL Snippet we will cover gender (both for older and younger) as well as the signs for body height and width. Pay special attention to my mouth expressions (known as "mouth morphemes"). These mouth morphemes are an important part of 
American Sign Language. So make sure you not only practice the signs, but also practice the mouth morphemes as you continue to learn ASL.

title.$t: Comparing two items - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Comparing two items - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: Let's learn our first concept in ASL - comparing whether two items are the same or different. Don't bother trying to turn up the volume or look for captions because there are none. I'm using ASL to teach you a concept in ASL. *smile* So, kick back and have fun learning!

content.$t: Let's learn our first concept in ASL - comparing whether two items are the same or different. Don't bother trying to turn up the volume or look for captions because there are none. I'm using ASL to teach you a concept in ASL. *smile* So, kick back and have fun learning!

title.$t: Introduction - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Introduction - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: Hello! This is my introduction video. I will be creating "ASL Snippets" on a regular basis that will cover some very basic concepts in ASL. These snippets are designed to encourage others to develop an interest in and learn about ASL. I am a full-time ASL teacher and in my spare time I am putting together a more in-depth website for learning ASL online (www.WestwoodASL.com/moodle). However, that is a slow process due to the amount of time it takes to create each lesson. So, enjoy these ASL Snippet videos. Please, share them with others. There are a lot of so-called "sign language videos" on YouTube but most of them have inaccurate information or are spreading misconceptions about what ASL really is. If you are an ASL teacher and have a desire to use these for your own students, please contact me first. I'm happy to let you use my videos, I just have some things I'd like to make you aware of. Thanks!

Thanks!

title.$t: Hair, eyes, nose, mouth, ears - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: Hair, eyes, nose, mouth, ears - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: This ASL Snippet covers some basic descriptive signs for hair, eyes, nose, mouth and ears. In ASL (American Sign Language) descriptions are very straightforward. Pay attention to my mouth morphemes (the mouth shapes I make) to describe sizes and lengths.

title.$t: ASL Poetry - "The Light" (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: ASL Poetry - "The Light" (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: This is a very simple poem that I composed several years ago as a way of demonstrating some very basic uses of rhythm and classifiers in ASL poetry. The rules of ASL poetry and other spoken/written forms of poetry are quite different and ASL poetry is a relatively very new field for artists and enthusiasts to explore and enjoy.

content.$t: This is a very simple poem that I composed several years ago as a way of demonstrating some very basic uses of rhythm and classifiers in ASL poetry. The rules of ASL poetry and other spoken/written forms of poetry are quite different and ASL poetry is a relatively very new field for artists and enthusiasts to explore and enjoy.

title.$t: ASL, What's That? - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: ASL, What's That? - ASL Snippets (American Sign Language)

media$description.$t: In this video, explain what ASL is, and what ASL is not. For those who are new to ASL (or know nothing about it) there can be quite a few misconceptions. So, before we jump into learning how to sign, I want to take a moment to cover some very simple basics about - "ASL, What's That?"

content.$t: In this video, explain what ASL is, and what ASL is not. For those who are new to ASL (or know nothing about it) there can be quite a few misconceptions. So, before we jump into learning how to sign, I want to take a moment to cover some very simple basics about - "ASL, What's That?"

title.$t: To all ASL students creating videos to 'teach ASL...

media$title.$t: To all ASL students creating videos to 'teach ASL...

media$description.$t:
As an ASL teacher and a Deaf individual I'm very concerned about the flood of videos being created by ASL students who think they are qualified to be teaching such a beautiful and complex language. 

ASL is being mangled and abused by "teachers" who don't fully understand the language and by "students" who don't make the effort to learn all the important little details (or aren't aware that there are a lot of those "little details"). So is it any wonder that so many Deaf people (myself included) are very unhappy with how our language is being warped? 

ASL is precious to the Deaf community. We cherish it and wish it would get the respect that it deserves. Frankly, it worries me because so many of these so-called "teaching" videos on YouTube create and spread a lot of errors and misconceptions about sign language, thus making the problem even worse at an even more rapid rate. 

This video is my comments to those who think it's "cool" to teach a language that they still don't understand themselves and suggestions to those who are interested in learning ASL accurately.

I'd like to ask a favor - If you would take some time to search for "sign language lessons Melissa Schenk" and then do a "thumbs down" on all of her signing videos, that would be wonderful. Ms. Schenk knows absolutely nothing about ASL. She is a "carpetbagger" that simply looked up signs out of a book and created videos. Ms. Schenk has made a number of "do it yourself" type videos for ExpertVillage (they pay you to do it) and her absolute, most popular videos are the signing ones. Thus, she is making money by teaching wrong signs. That disgusts me that she takes advantage of something she knows nothing about in order to make money by spreading incorrect information at the expense of the Deaf and our language. Please, vote thumbs down on her videos and even feel free to leave a comment.


http://www.WestwoodASL.com/moodle



Learn ASL American Sign Language Lessons Deaf Teach

title.$t: The Lord's Prayer (ASL, American Sign Language)

media$title.$t: The Lord's Prayer (ASL, American Sign Language)

media$description.$t:
http://www.WestwoodASL.com - This is a simple version of The Lord's Prayer based on the New World Translation of the Bible (Jehovah's Witnesses). This video is not intended to teach those learning ASL how to sign the Lord's Prayer. Rather, this is a REVIEW for my student to practice at home. (She has already learned the signs for the Lord's Prayer in our tutoring sessions.) So please, no comments about it being too fast or not clear enough for you. Thanks!

http://www.WestwoodASL.com/moodle

http://www.WestwoodASL.com - This is a simple version of The Lord's Prayer based on the New World Translation of the Bible (Jehovah's Witnesses). title.$t: Learn American Sign Language (ASL, lessons, Deaf)

media$title.$t: Learn American Sign Language (ASL, lessons, Deaf)

media$description.$t:
http://www.WestwoodASL.com - Introducing a new website for learning American Sign Language (ASL). This website covers signs, grammar, cultural and historical aspects of the language and the community that uses it.

Due to the popularity of the TV series "Switched at Birth" staring Katie Leclerc and Sean Berdy, there has been a huge interest in learning sign language recently. Please be careful about what videos you watch here on YouTube to learn ASL. Many of these videos are full of misinformation and inaccurate signs.

http://www.WestwoodASL.com/moodle

title.$t: Star-Spangled Banner in American Sign Language (ASL, National Anthem, Fourth of July, July 4th)

media$title.$t: Star-Spangled Banner in American Sign Language (ASL, National Anthem, Fourth of July, July 4th)

media$description.$t:
http://www.WestwoodASL.com This video still needs some work - way too much ghosting around the edges compared to my other videos. However, I wanted to get this video out to celebrate July 4th. If I can fix the ghosting problem I'll upload a better one later.

This version of the Star-Spangled Banner in American Sign Language is a simplified one that I teach my ASL students. I have made a few minor changes in this version compared to the older one to make it more accurate. Enjoy!

http://www.WestwoodASL.com/moodle
